description: Unique code for the maintenance task/program this rule governs (e.g., inspection or PM template).
Scheduling basis for the task: Fixed dates do not slide after completion; Floating dates reset based on last completion.
Indicator whether a due date is allowed to fall on Saturday; if not, the system will shift the date. Likely 0=no, 1=yes; confirm with SME.
Indicator whether a due date is allowed to fall on Sunday; if not, the system will shift the date. Likely 0=no, 1=yes; confirm with SME.
Number of calendar days before the due date to begin triggering the event (e.g., create WO or alert).
Lead threshold in meter units (miles, hours, etc.) before the meter-based due value to trigger scheduling.
Start of the first blackout window when this task should not be scheduled or due; date/time format may vary. Confirm with SME.
End of the first blackout window when this task should not be scheduled or due.
Start of the second blackout window when this task should not be scheduled or due.
End of the second blackout window when this task should not be scheduled or due.
Whether to generate the next occurrence when a prior work order for this task is still open (Y=allow overlap, N=wait).
User ID who created the rule record.
Timestamp when the rule record was created.
User ID who last updated the rule record.
Timestamp of the most recent update to the rule record.
If Y, automatically create a work order when this rule becomes due.
If Y, generate an alert/notification when this rule becomes due.
Message content to display in the generated alert.
Priority/severity level assigned to the generated alert (e.g., info, warning, critical).
Flag controlling whether the same asset can have multiple active schedule instances under this rule; confirm with SME.
